text: <@U018DRGAC5S> Just keep in mind that 'abstract nonsense' like category theory is, first and foremost, _nonsense_. It is utterly meaningless to a typical person. More generally, human language is lousy for describing anything that is abstract. Concrete examples are needed if only just to indicate what is being talked about. Motivating examples add a further emotional appeal, a reason why the topic is important. For example, if I propose the Patriot Act, there will be little interest until a motivating example like 9/11 comes along. The presentation must make the audience *want it*.
